etymology.description: Phono-semantic: 豈(豈) (qǐ, "drum") + 几(几) (jǐ, phonetic) = music of triumph -> victorious
etymology.interpretation: '凱' combines 豈(豈) (qǐ, "drum") representing the triumphant music and 几(几) (jǐ) as the phonetic component. Originally, this composition reflected music played during victorious celebrations.
etymology.simplification: Simplified as 凯 by replacing 豈(豈) (qǐ, "drum") with 己(己) (jǐ, "self") for phonetic resemblance, reducing complexity.

examples.chinese: 凯带领球队夺得冠军(凱帶領球隊奪得冠軍)。
examples.english: Kai led the team to win the championship.

examples.chinese: 比赛结束后(比賽結束後)，他以凯的姿态走向领奖台(他以凱的姿態走向領獎台)。
examples.pinyin: Bǐsài jiéshù hòu, tā yǐ kǎi de zītài zǒuxiàng lǐngjiǎngtái.
examples.english: After the game, he walked to the podium with a victorious demeanor.

examples.chinese: 在艰难比赛中(在艱難比賽中)，他展现出凯的风采(他展現出凱的風采)。
examples.pinyin: Zài jiānnán bǐsài zhōng, tā zhǎnxiàn chū kǎi de fēngcǎi.
examples.english: In the tough competition, he demonstrated a triumphant air.
